gurmukhi: ਪਾਹਨ ਕੀ ਰੇਖ ਅਾਦਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਨਿਰਬਾਹੁ ਕਰੈ ਟਰੈ ਨ ਸਨੇਹੁ ਸਾਧ ਬਿਗ੍ਹੁ ਅਸਾਧ ਕੋ
transliteration: Paahan Kee Raykh Aadi Anti Nirabaahu Karai , Tarai N Sanayhu Saadh Bigrahu Asaadh Ko ?
translation: Just as a line drawn on a stone cannot be effaced and lasts till the stone perishes, so is the love of holy men with the Lord's feet and of vicious persons with evil.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਜਲ ਮੈ ਲਕੀਰ ਧੀਰ ਨ ਧਰਤਿ ਤਤ ਅਧਮ ਕੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਅੳੁ ਬਿਰੁਧ ਜੁਧ ਸਾਧ ਕੋ
transliteration: Jaisay Jal Mai Lakeer Dheer N Dharati Tata , Adham Kee Preeti Au Birudh Judh Saadh Ko ?
translation: Just as line drawn on water does not last for a moment, so does the love of a wicked person and opposition or discord of a noble man vanishes in a wink.

gurmukhi: ਥੋਹਰਿ ੳੁਖਾਰੀ ੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਅੳੁ ਬਿਕਾਰੀ ਸਹਜਿ ਸੁਭਾਵ ਸਾਧ ਅਧਮ ੳੁਪਾਧ ਕੋ
transliteration: Dohari Oukhaaree Oupakaaree Au Bikaaree , Sahaji Soubhaav Saadh Adham Oupaadh Ko ?
translation: Just as cactus is painful due to its thorns and sugarcane is comforting and pleasant for its sweet juice, so is the temperament of an evil person who raises unpleasant situations while a saintly person remains peaceful and Endeavours to spread peace and h

gurmukhi: ਗੁੰਜਾਫਲ ਮਾਨਕ ਸੰਸਾਰਿ ਤੁਲਾਧਾਰਿ ਬਿਖੈ ਤੋਲਿ ਕੈ ਸਮਾਨਿ ਮੋਲ ਅਲਪ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਕੋ ॥੩੮੩॥
transliteration: Gounjaadhal Maanak Sansaari Tulaadhaari Bikhai , Toli Kai Samaani Mol Alap Agaadhi Ko ?383?
translation: Just as a ruby and a seed of Abrus Precatorius (Ratti) both being red in colour may look alike but the seed of Abrus Precatorius (Ratti) is insignificant in value as compared to ruby. Similarly a noble and an evil person may look same but an evil person i
